alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 10 at 9:50PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, Chesterfield, City of Richmond and Henrico. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water is occurring in urban areas as per cameras. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 948 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen since this morning. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.25 inches are expected over the area over the next 3 hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Richmond, Downtown Richmond, Virginia Commonwealth University, Virginia Union University, University Of Richmond, Bon Air, Tuckahoe, Highland Springs, Mechanicsville, Chester, Bensley, Lakeside, East Highland Park, Bellwood, Laurel, Chesterfield Court House, Glen Allen, Wyndham, Drewrys Bluff and Richmond Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
